alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 7:06PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Coffee and Dale. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 705 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daleville, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Level Plains, New Brockton, Clayhatchee, Coppinville, Gerald, Lowe Army Heliport, Shell Army Field, Cairns Aaf, Clintonville and Knox Field. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
